name: European Alliance of News Agencies
goal: Founded on August 21st 1956, after a conference in Strasbourg, The European Alliance of News Agencies (EANA) is a cooperation and information exchange forum of European news agencies. EANA consists of 32 news agencies promoting and respecting copyright, access to quality information, technological development of media and, last but not least, freedom of press.
interests: Business and Industry, Competition, Culture, Culture and media, Digital economy and society, Research and innovation
euInitiatives: EANA's current main focus, when it comes to EU initiatives, is the EU Copyright Directive.
